title: Part a.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Both expenditure approach and income approach (or value added of final goods)
descriptions:
No point earned.

Both expenditure approach and income approach (or value added of final goods)

Earns 1 of 1 point.

Both expenditure approach and income approach (or value added of final goods)

title: Part b.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Sum of factor payments + profits (Income) = Expenditures (1 point) Or, a good circular flow model will earn one point.
descriptions:
No point earned.

Sum of factor payments + profits (Income) = Expenditures (1 point) Or, a good circular flow model will earn one point.

Earns 1 of 1 point.

Sum of factor payments + profits (Income) = Expenditures (1 point) Or, a good circular flow model will earn one point.

title: Part c.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

1 point for any one of the following:

  • underground or illegal economy

  • barter

  • home production

  • externalities
descriptions:
No point earned.

1 point for any one of the following:

  • underground or illegal economy

  • barter

  • home production

  • externalities

Earns 1 of 1 point.

1 point for any one of the following:

  • underground or illegal economy

  • barter

  • home production

  • externalities

title: Part d.
stimulusHtml:
2 points

1 point per correct response (maximum of two points)

  • inflation rate

  • population growth

  • change in the income distribution

  • change in externalities

  • change in leisure time

  • change in product quality
descriptions:
No points earned.

1 point per correct response (maximum of two points)

  • inflation rate

  • population growth

  • change in the income distribution

  • change in externalities

  • change in leisure time

  • change in product quality

Earns 1 of 2 points.

1 point per correct response (maximum of two points)

  • inflation rate

  • population growth

  • change in the income distribution

  • change in externalities

  • change in leisure time

  • change in product quality

Earns 2 of 2 points.
